results.title: Psycho (1998) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s faithful scene by scene colour ‘recreation’ (the term preferred by the director over ‘remake’) of Hitchcock’s classic thriller about the fate of Marion Crane (Anne Heche in the role made famous by Janet Leigh) who, on-the-run with a large amount of stolen cash, stops at an isolated motel run by Norman Bates (Vince Vaughn) , where she meets an untimely end. Cast also includes Julianne Moore as Marion’s sister and William H. Macy as the private investigator she hires to find her sister.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Universal Pictures, Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer and Gus Van Sant

results.title: Psycho (1960) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions, Paramount Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herrmann’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.

results.title: Psychics, saints and scientists
results.creator_credit: Irving Hartley, Hartley Productions and Harvey F. Bellin
results.brief_description: Parapsychologist Thelma Moss introduces the field of psychic phenomena and acts as mistress of ceremonies for a discussion by scientists who are responsible for particular areas of study, such as healing, bio-feedback training, psychokinesis, telepathy, and extrasensory perception. Explains that only recently has parapsychology gained respect as a field of serious scientific consideration.

results.title: Pruning practices at the Brooklyn Botanic Gardens
results.creator_credit: Centre for Mass Communication and Stuart Chasmar
results.brief_description: Shows how proper pruning produces healthy plants of good appearance. Demonstrates techniques of pruning deciduous and evergreen trees, roses, rhododendron, forsythia, lilac, hedges etc., and follows the growth of the plants through the year.

results.title: Provincial actors = Aktorzy Prowincjonalni
results.brief_description: A savvy director arrives in a small Polish town to put on a play titled, “Liberation”. He enlists predominately the men of the local theatre troupe to star in the play whilst the women and various members of the local community assist as stagehands. As preparations commence, however, tensions and conflicts arise: disagreements abound over the play’s interpretation; resentments surface between co-workers and bosses. These grievances threaten to undo not only the production itself, but also personal relationships and the harmony of the community at large. The relationship between the lead star, Chris, and his wife, Anna, suffers the most as Chris’ self-importance and ambition lead him to neglect his wife and disregard her opinion on his performance. Agnieszka Holland adopts a realist, understated approach in her early film, “Provincial actors”, and reflects ironically and engagingly on what goes on ‘behind the scenes’: matters of ego, class and gender divisions, the difficulty of working together. By doing so she shows how the ideals and values expressed in art, such as equality, community and justice, often do not get applied in reality. In fact, theatre and performance is seen to be a breeding ground for egoism, ill communication and disrespect toward others. A winning quality of this film, however, lies in its dynamic, fluid group scenes where the actors drink, eat and relax together, and the distinction between public and private, mask and inner self dissolves. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Providing for independence in learning (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Kismet Films and Robert E. Gilbert
results.brief_description: Outlines the need for providing children with the opportunity and skills for independent learning. Points out the role of the school and the library in developing self direction skills and providing opportunities for the disadvantaged child.

results.title: Providence
results.creator_credit: Klaus Hellwig, Yves Peyrot, Yves Gasser and Alain Resnais
results.brief_description:
This is a perversely hilarious comedy about one restless night (among many) in the fading life of ageing, over-sexed novelist, Clive Langham. Clive lives alone in a country mansion and spends his nights cursing his fate as he inserts suppositories, sits on the ‘throne’ and downs bottle after bottle of white wine. In his nightmare, the characters of his novel mix with his real life relatives. As Clive gathers his relatives around him for a final week-end and they attempt to nurse him back to life, he realises that they are not the monsters he perceived them to be.

Credits: Produces, Yves Gasser, Yves Renot, Klaus Hellwig ; director, Alain Resnais ; writers, David Mercer ; photography, Ricardo Aronovitch ; music, Miklos Rozsa ; art direction, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Dirk Bogarde, Ellen Burstyn, John Gielgud, David Warner, Elain Stritch, Peter Arne.
